benchmark_details.name: LLMDetect
benchmark_details.overview: LLMDetect is a benchmark designed to evaluate detectorsâ€™ performance on new tasks for detecting LLM-generated content, including LLM Role Recognition and LLM Involvement Measurement.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a new detection paradigm that moves beyond binary classification for detecting LLM-generated content.

data.source: Hybrid News Detection Corpus (HNDC) consisting of human-written articles curated from reputable sources.
data.annotation: Annotated with LLM role and involvement ratio.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions and ground truth in various tasks.
methodology.interpretation: High F1 scores indicate better performance in identifying LLM-generated content.
methodology.baseline_results: Fine-tuned PLM-based models consistently outperform other baseline models across both tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through training and testing on the HNDC and DetectEval components.
